headline: Raymond James resumes Apple coverage, flags limited upside at current valuation
summary: Investing.com -- Raymond James resumed coverage of Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) with a “market perform” rating on Friday, saying the company’s current valuation already reflects its fundamentals and leaves limited scope for near-term outperformance.

content.title: Raymond James resumes Apple coverage, flags limited upside at current valuation

headline: Sam Altman Is Trying to Take On the App Store. He’s Got a Long Way to Go.
summary: Sam Altman  wants OpenAI to have an app store to rival  Apple’s  Early tests suggest he’s got a long way to go.  If ChatGPT’s more than 800 million users want to buy groceries from  Instacart  create a playlist with Spotify or find a hike on AllTrails, now they can do so inside the chatbot instead of opening an iPhone app.  In theory that threatens Apple’s impregnable walled garden.

If ChatGPT’s more than 800 million users want to buy groceries from  Instacart  create a playlist with Spotify or find a hike on AllTrails, now they can do so inside the chatbot instead of opening an iPhone app.  In theory that threatens Apple’s impregnable walled garden.

headline: Joe Rogan Defends Billionaires, Saying 'They're Working 16 Hours A Day.' He Also Thinks Sharing The Wealth Would Make People Hate Them Less

headline: Apple Stock’s Growth Trajectory Is Challenged in 2026. Why This Analyst Is Staying on the Sidelines.

headline: CES 2026: The costs of memory chips amid tech's data center pivot
summary: The costs of memory chips — especially those used in consumer devices — are expected to see a sharp rise in 2026 as more mega-cap tech companies ramp up their CapEx spending into AI infrastructure and data center projects. Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley discusses the pricing pressures and demand surrounding these memory chip manufacturers and DRAM (Dynamic Random Access Memory). Also catch Dan Howley lay out what to expect in Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's keynote address at the 2026 Consumer Technology Association (CES) event on Monday, January 5. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: CES 2026: The costs of memory chips amid tech's data center pivot
content.description:
The costs of memory chips — especially those used in consumer devices — are expected to see a sharp rise in 2026 as more mega-cap tech companies ramp up their CapEx spending into AI infrastructure and data center projects.

Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley discusses the pricing pressures and demand surrounding these memory chip manufacturers and DRAM (Dynamic Random Access Memory).

Also catch Dan Howley lay out what to expect in Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's keynote address at the 2026 Consumer Technology Association (CES) event on Monday, January 5.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: The costs of memory chips — especially those used in consumer devices — are expected to see a sharp rise in 2026 as more mega-cap tech companies ramp up their CapEx spending into AI infrastructure and data center projects. Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley discusses the pricing pressures and demand surrounding these memory chip manufacturers and DRAM (Dynamic Random Access Memory). headline: Is Berkshire Hathaway a Still a Buy Now That Buffett’s Retired?
summary: The great Warren Buffett, a man known as the Oracle of Omaha, has finally retired after a legendary 60-year career that helped power Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK-B) to annualized gains that have nearly doubled that of the S&P 500 (close to 20% vs. 10.4% for the S&P 500). It’s certainly the end of an era, and ... Is Berkshire Hathaway a Still a Buy Now That Buffett’s Retired?

headline: OpenAI Is Taking On Apple’s App Store. It’s Got a Long Way to Go.
summary: Sam Altman  wants OpenAI to have an app store to rival Apple’s. Early tests suggest he’s got a long way to go.  If ChatGPT’s more than 800 million users want to buy groceries from Instacart, create a playlist with Spotify or find a hike on AllTrails, now they can do so inside the chatbot instead of opening an iPhone app.  In theory that threatens Apple’s impregnable walled garden.

content.title: OpenAI Is Taking On Apple’s App Store. It’s Got a Long Way to Go.
content.summary: Sam Altman  wants OpenAI to have an app store to rival Apple’s. Early tests suggest he’s got a long way to go.  If ChatGPT’s more than 800 million users want to buy groceries from Instacart, create a playlist with Spotify or find a hike on AllTrails, now they can do so inside the chatbot instead of opening an iPhone app.  In theory that threatens Apple’s impregnable walled garden.
